00052 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00053 Thread::Thread(const SimpleString Name /* = SimpleString::EmptyString */)

00056 #endif

00064     ThreadHandle  = NULL;
00065 #else
00066     m_thread = (pthread_t)0;
00067 #endif

00070     StopWasAsked = false;

00080
00081 bool Thread::StartThread()
00082 {
00083     // do nothing if already running
00084     if ( IsRunning() )
00085     {
00086         return false;
00087     }
00088
00089     ThreadIsRunning = false;
00090     StopWasAsked = false;
00091
00092 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00093     OmiscidTrace( "StartThread : %s\n", ThreadName.GetStr() );
00094 #endif
00095 
00096 #ifdef WIN32
00097     ThreadID = 0;
00098     ThreadHandle = CreateThread( NULL, 0, CallRun, (void*)this, 0, &ThreadID );
00099     return (ThreadHandle != NULL);
00100 #else
00101     pthread_attr_t attr;
00102
00103     pthread_attr_init(&attr);
00104     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00105     int rc = pthread_create(&m_thread, &attr, CallRun, this);
00106     pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);
00107
00108     return (rc == 0);
00109 #endif
00110 }
00111
00112 bool Thread::StopThread(int wait_ms)
00113 {
00114     bool ThreadStopInTime = true;
00115
00116     if (IsRunning())
00117     {
00118 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00119         OmiscidTrace( "Ask %s to stop.\n", ThreadName.GetStr() );
00120 #endif
00121 
00122         // Notify thread !
00123         StopWasAsked = true;                    // Notification for pseudo active waiting
00124         StopWasAskedEvent.Signal();             // other notification
00125
00126         ThreadStopInTime = IsEnded.Wait(wait_ms);
00127         if ( ThreadStopInTime == false )
00128         {
00129             // Timeout !!!
00130 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00131             OmiscidError( "Thread::StopThread: %s do not stop before timeout (%d).\n",  ThreadName.GetStr(), wait_ms );
00132 #else
00133             OmiscidError( "Thread::StopThread: Thread do not stop before timeout (%d).\n",  wait_ms );
00134 #endif
00135 
00136             // Destroy the thread...
00137 #ifdef WIN32
00138             // TerminateThread( ThreadHandle, 0 );
00139             ThreadID = 0;
00140             ThreadHandle  = NULL;
00141 #else
00142             // pthread_cancel(m_thread);
00143 #endif
00144         }
00145     }
00146
00147 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00148     OmiscidTrace( "Thread %s stopped.\n", ThreadName.GetStr() );
00149 #endif
00150 
00151     return ThreadStopInTime;
00152 }
00153
00154 #ifdef WIN32
00155 unsigned long FUNCTION_CALL_TYPE Thread::CallRun(void* ptr)
00156 #else
00157 void* Thread::CallRun(void* ptr)
00158 #endif
00159 {
00160     Thread* t = (Thread*)ptr;
00161
00162     // init thread random generator
00163     RandomInit();
00164
00165     // Reset stat event
00166     t->IsEnded.Reset();
00167
00168 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00169     t->ThreadName += "(";
00170     t->ThreadName += t->GetThreadId();
00171     t->ThreadName += ")";
00172     OmiscidTrace( "%s started\n", t->ThreadName.GetStr() );
00173 #endif
00174 
00175     // Do my job
00176     t->ThreadIsRunning = true;
00177     t->Run();
00178     t->ThreadIsRunning = false;
00179
00180 #ifdef WIN32
00181 
00182     // Close the Thread handle
00183     // CloseHandle( ThreadHandle );
00184
00185     t->ThreadID = 0;
00186     t->ThreadHandle = NULL;
00187 #else
00188     // m_thread : something to do with ?
00189 #endif
00190 
00191     // signal, my job is over
00192     t->IsEnded.Signal();
00193
00194 #ifdef WIN32
00195     return 0;
00196 #else
00197     pthread_exit(NULL);
00198 #endif
00199 }

00201 void Thread::Sleep(int nb_ms)
00202 {
00203 #ifdef WIN32
00204     // Use SleepEx because accuracy of the wait time is better than with ::Sleep
00205     ::SleepEx(nb_ms, FALSE);
00206 #else
00207     usleep(nb_ms*1000);
00208 #endif
00209 }

00266 bool Thread::WaitAndGetMessage( ThreadMessage& MsgToGet, unsigned int DelayMax /* = (unsigned int)DEFAULT_MESSAGE_TIMEOUT */ )
00267 {
00268     bool Done;
00269
00270     SmartLocker SL_MsgQueue(MsgQueue, false);
00271
00272     if ( DelayMax == 0 )
00273     {
00274         // INFINITE wait
00275         Done = false;
00276         while( true ) // was for(;;) but new version of MS compiler do no like it
00277         {
00278             // Is there a message ?
00279             SL_MsgQueue.Lock();
00280             if ( MsgQueue.GetNumberOfElements() != 0 )
00281             {
00282                 MsgToGet = MsgQueue.ExtractFirst();
00283                 Done = true;
00284             }
00285             SL_MsgQueue.Unlock();
00286
00287             if ( Done == true )
00288             {
00289                 return true;
00290             }
00291
00292             // Wait
00293             Sleep( 10 );
00294         }
00295         // never here
00296         return true;
00297     }
00298     else
00299     {
00300         ElapsedTime CountWaitedTime;
00301         Done = false;
00302         while( true ) // was for(;;) but new version of MS compiler do no like it
00303         {
00304             // Is there a message ?
00305             SL_MsgQueue.Lock();
00306             if ( MsgQueue.GetNumberOfElements() != 0 )
00307             {
00308                 MsgToGet = MsgQueue.ExtractFirst();
00309                 Done = true;
00310             }
00311             SL_MsgQueue.Unlock();
00312
00313             if ( Done == true )
00314             {
00315                 return true;
00316             }
00317
00318             if ( Done == true || CountWaitedTime.Get() >= DelayMax )
00319             {
00320                 return Done;
00321             }
00322
00323             Sleep( 10 );
00324         }
00325         // never here
00326         return true;
00327     }
00328
00329     return false;
00330 }
00331
00336 bool Thread::GetMessage( ThreadMessage& MsgToSend )
00337 {
00338     SmartLocker SL_MsgQueue(MsgQueue);
00339
00340     if ( MsgQueue.GetNumberOfElements() == 0 )
00341     {
00342         // No message
00343         return false;
00344     }
00345
00346     // get first message
00347     MsgToSend = MsgQueue.ExtractFirst();
00348     return true;
00349 }
